title: Music and Memory: The Last Thing Alzheimer's Takes
description: One-minute skill: Music and Memory: The Last Thing Alzheimer's Takes.

hook.text: Patients who can't remember their own names can sing every word of songs from their youth.

buildup.text: Musical memories are stored across multiple brain regions â€” motor, auditory, emotional, linguistic â€” making them.

discovery.text: Alzheimer's destroys the hippocampus first (recent memories).

twist.text: Playing familiar music to Alzheimer's patients can temporarily restore verbal fluency, reduce agitation, and trigger.

climax.text: Music therapy is now prescribed in many countries for dementia care.

punchline.text: Music is the last memory to leave. And the first to bring us back.

quiz.question: Why does musical memory survive Alzheimer's longer than other memories?
options: Music is processed by a single brain region
